  • Element
gsonpath

Annotation Type AutoGsonAdapter


  • @Retention(value=SOURCE)
@Target(value=TYPE)
public @interface AutoGsonAdapter
    A class annotated with this annotation will automatically generate a Gson TypeAdapter at compile time.

    The benefit of this annotation is that it removes the majority of reflection used by Gson, and also avoids problems caused by obfuscators such as proguard since the field names are not obtained at runtime, instead they are statically referenced ahead of time.

    Another benefit of this generated TypeAdapter class is that the com.google.gson.annotations.SerializedName gson annotation is able to use very basic JsonPath style notation. It can specify a tree branch notation which allows the POJO to be much flatter than standard implementations

    For example, for a given JSON file: 

     {
      "value1": 1
      "left": {
          "path": {
              "value2": 1
          }
      }
 }
    And a class annotated as follows: 
    
 @AutoGsonAdapter
 class LeftPath
 {
      int value1;
      @SerializedName("left.path.value2") // or @SerializedName("left.path.")
      int value2;
 }
    The generated TypeAdapter will map this nested JSON into a single POJO without any boilerplate code being written.

    Note: As a consequence of generating code at compile time, some flexibility is lost surrounding Gson configurations. Therefore any Gson specific configurations (such as GsonPathFieldNamingPolicy) must be specified within the annotation itself.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.Class<?> defaultConfiguration
      Specifies a set of defaults which can be used to set a different set of defaults as opposed to the ones provided out of the box.
      GsonPathFieldNamingPolicy fieldNamingPolicy
      Exposes the Gson field naming policy at compile time rather than runtime.
      GsonFieldValidationType fieldValidationType
      Defines validation rule which can be used to ensure that the parsed JSON conforms to a particular format.
      FlattenDelimiter flattenDelimiter
      The delimiter used to flatten Json nested structures into a single POJO.
      InheritableBoolean ignoreNonAnnotatedFields
      Determines whether fields that do not use the 'SerializedName' gson annotation are added to the Type Adapter or not.
      java.lang.String rootField
      Specifies the root field where the generated TypeAdapter will begin to access the declared fields.
      InheritableBoolean serializeNulls
      Determines whether the Type Adapter will allow null values into the JSON when writing.
      PathSubstitution[] substitutions
      An array of substitutions which are applied to all fields annotated with com.google.gson.annotations.SerializedName.

    • Element Detail

      • defaultConfiguration

        public abstract java.lang.Class<?> defaultConfiguration
        Specifies a set of defaults which can be used to set a different set of defaults as opposed to the ones provided out of the box.

        For further information about how to use this, see GsonPathDefaultConfiguration

        Default:
        void.class

      • ignoreNonAnnotatedFields

        public abstract InheritableBoolean ignoreNonAnnotatedFields
        Determines whether fields that do not use the 'SerializedName' gson annotation are added to the Type Adapter or not. By default all fields are added.

        To exclude fields on a case-by-case basis, see ExcludeField

        Default:
        gsonpath.InheritableBoolean.FALSE_OR_INHERIT_DEFAULT_IF_AVAILABLE

      • rootField

        public abstract java.lang.String rootField
        Specifies the root field where the generated TypeAdapter will begin to access the declared fields.

        If left blank, nothing will change, and the fields will be read immediately from the reader.

        However, if the root field is specified, then the reader will drill down into a specific tree branch of the JSON and then commence reading the exposed fields.

        E.g. For a given JSON file: 

         {
      "left": {
          "path": {
              "value1": 1
          }
          "ignored": "unused"
      },
      "right" {
          "ignored": "unused"
      }
 }
        And a class annotated as follows: 
        
 @AutoGsonAdapter(rootField = "left.path")
 class LeftPath
 {
      int value1;
 }
        Then the reader will read into the 'left' and 'path' section of the JSON and then read the 'value1' property as usual.
        Default:
        ""

      • flattenDelimiter

        public abstract FlattenDelimiter flattenDelimiter
        The delimiter used to flatten Json nested structures into a single POJO.

        By default this is set to using the '.' character. If required you can override this to using a different character, and all the fields within this class will use this delimiter instead.

        Value will inherit from a 'defaults' class which uses the GsonPathDefaultConfiguration annotation. If you don't wish to inherit, specify an explicit delimiter.

        Default:
        @gsonpath.FlattenDelimiter(value=46, inheritDefaultIfAvailable=true)

      • fieldNamingPolicy

        public abstract GsonPathFieldNamingPolicy fieldNamingPolicy
        Exposes the Gson field naming policy at compile time rather than runtime.

        Note: This will affect every version of this class regardless of how the gson object is constructed.

        Value will inherit from a 'defaults' class which uses the GsonPathDefaultConfiguration annotation. If you don't wish to inherit, specify an explicit fieldNamingPolicy.

        Default:
        gsonpath.GsonPathFieldNamingPolicy.IDENTITY_OR_INHERIT_DEFAULT_IF_AVAILABLE

      • serializeNulls

        public abstract InheritableBoolean serializeNulls
        Determines whether the Type Adapter will allow null values into the JSON when writing.

        Refer to the Gson documentation for further details.

        Default:
        gsonpath.InheritableBoolean.FALSE_OR_INHERIT_DEFAULT_IF_AVAILABLE

      • fieldValidationType

        public abstract GsonFieldValidationType fieldValidationType
        Defines validation rule which can be used to ensure that the parsed JSON conforms to a particular format.

        If the validation is enabled and a JSON document does not conform, an exception will be thrown, and the parser will stop immediately.

        The validation is relies on the 'NonNull' (also 'Nonnull', 'NotNull' and 'Notnull') and 'Nullable' annotations.

        The feature allows you to create a contract where you can be sure that the POJO has all the data that you expect.

        Default:
        gsonpath.GsonFieldValidationType.NO_VALIDATION_OR_INHERIT_DEFAULT_IF_AVAILABLE

      • substitutions

        public abstract PathSubstitution[] substitutions
        An array of substitutions which are applied to all fields annotated with com.google.gson.annotations.SerializedName.

        This also includes fields which are inherited. It provides a useful mechanism to reuse the same model for json with different names, but a similar structure.

        See the PathSubstitution Javadoc for more details.

        Default:
        {}
